title: VERA FILES FACT CHECK: Duterte’s claim about his salary still inaccurate
subtitle: It's the fourth time he has understated his pay by VERA Files Fact Check’s count.
author: verafiles.org
vclaim:
President Rodrigo Duterte again understated his salary, the fourth time he has done so by VERA Files Fact Check’s count.

In an Oct. 27 speech during the Masskara Festival in Bacolod City, Duterte said:

Duterte’s claim is off by P91,083; since January 2018, he has been receiving P298,083 monthly.

He has previously understated his salary in January and April 2017 by P92,278, and in February this year by P98,083. (See VERA FILES FACT CHECK: How much does President Duterte earn monthly? and VERA FILES FACT CHECK: Duterte understates his salary again)

Duterte’s salary has been increasing since 2016 due to Executive Order No. 201, signed by his predecessor Benigno Simeon Aquino III, which raised the annual pay for all civil servants.

In January 2019, Duterte is expected to receive P399,739 monthly, as the fourth tranche of the modified salary schedule will have been released.

Department of Budget and Management, National Budget Circular No. 572, Jan. 3, 2018

(Guided by the code of principles of the International Fact-Checking Network at Poynter, VERA Files tracks the false claims, flip-flops, misleading statements of public officials and figures, and debunks them with factual evidence. Find out more about this initiative and our methodology.)
